intro: Malvastrum elatum, commonly known as the showy mallows, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
